title: Font ID and organic/handcrafted font recommendations
content:
Hi!

I’m trying to track down this font (script) even though I think it may be a custom font. The closest I could find was Dear Sarah but that is more oblique/slanted than I would like. Any recommendations for other typefaces with this organic/handcrafted type of feel? I have looked at the following: Olduval, Galahad, Baker Script, Modern Blues, Sunshine and Tree. Basically, I am looking for a font to serve as a starting point for a logo for a handmade jewelery (beads, etc.) company.

Thanks so much!

Josh

 [‹ Substitue for Gotham.](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/typophile.com/node/19442 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font for my Blog ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/typophile.com/node/19413 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jjdewtt

comments.content:
My apologies, my previous post did not include an attached file. Here is a link to the font in question: [http://www.allegrocoffee.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.allegrocoffee.com/ "http://www.allegrocoffee.com") The script font in the allegro logo... Thanks again.

Josh

That was probably hand drawn. You are best off hiring a good letterer, but here are some ideas:

[Pablo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=ITC.9086.0.0)  
 [Vincent](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=PY.114327.0.0)  
 [Schooner Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.108945.0.0)  
 [Chanson d’Amour](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=MVB.102378.0.0)  
 [Constitution](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.116742.0.0)

Thanks so much for your input! I may pursue Cezanne as a solution.  
Thanks again.

Josh

Viner Hand ( [http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=viner+hand](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=viner+hand "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=viner+hand"))

P22 Dearest ( [http://p22.com/ihof/dearest.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/p22.com/ihof/dearest.html "http://p22.com/ihof/dearest.html"))

P22, Veer, Myfonts have others as well. La Danse from P22 is quite nice.

[http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=script+distressed&pricem...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=script+distressed&pricemodel=RF,RM&producttype=TYP "http://www.veer.com/search/results.aspx?keyword=script+distressed&pricemodel=RF,RM&producttype=TYP")

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script+handwriting](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script+handwriting "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=script+handwriting")
I wouldn’t use Cezanne for a logo. It’s been used so often for so many things that it will fail at helping to create an original brand.

[http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104233023/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/joebob/")

At the risk of starting another thread about using women to advertise typefaces:)  
Tim
